channel.title: BBC Sport
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: 'Abandoned' or 'business' - was Glasner right to 'attack' Palace owners?
item.description: Oliver Glasner's outburst after Crystal Palace were beaten at Sunderland has led to increased speculation over his future at the club but will he be sacked?

item.title: Spurs chiefs consider sacking Frank as fans turn
item.description: Tottenham head coach Thomas Frank is under significant internal scrutiny with the club considering calling time on his seven-month reign.

item.title: Barry secures deserved win for Everton against Villa
item.description: Everton's Thierno Barry capitalises on a mistake by Aston Villa's Emi Martinez for a 1-0 win to The Toffees, which stops Villa going second in the Premier League.

item.title: Celtic host Dundee in one of two last 16 all-Premiership ties
item.description: Celtic will face Dundee, and holders Aberdeen welcome Motherwell, in the only two all-Premiership ties in the last 16 of this season's Scottish Cup.

item.title: 'No-one says anything in your face' - Martinez hits back at Scholes and Butt
item.description: Pundits discussing Man Utd "can talk on the television" but "no-one says anything" to your face, according to defender Lisandro Martinez.

item.title: Man arrested after elbow incident in grassroots match
item.description: Police are investigating an incident in which a football player appeared to deliberately elbow an opponent in the face during a Welsh grassroots match.

item.title: Newcastle miss out on top five spot after draw with Wolves
item.description: Wolves held Newcastle United to a goalless draw to prevent Eddie Howe's side from climbing into the top five of the Premier League table.

item.title: Everton win over Villa 'incredibly satisfying' - Moyes
item.description: Everton manager David Moyes says his side's performance against Aston Villa was "incredibly satisfying" as they won 1-0 at Villa Park.

item.title: Villa did not deliver against 'fantastic' Everton - Emery
item.description: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery is disappointed that his team were unable to convert any of their chances in their 1-0 defeat by "fantastic" Everton.

item.title: Olise shines as Bayern score five second-half goals
item.description: Former Crystal Palace forward Michael Olise comes off the bench to grab a goal and three assists to help Bayern Munich fight back and beat RB Leipzig 5-1 at the Red Bull Arena.

item.title: Edwards sees hope for Wolves after 'spirited display'
item.description: Wolverhampton Wanderers manager Rob Edwards says his side showed a "spirited display" against Newcastle United, noting that he sees belief returning to his players after going five matches unbeaten.

item.title: Goals galore in FA Cup as Liverpool, Man Utd & Man City progress
item.description: Liverpool, Manchester City and Manchester United all cruise into the fifth round of the Women's FA Cup as 55 goals are scored across 12 matches on Sunday.

item.title: Premier League leads call for temporary concussion subs
item.description: The Premier League again joins forces with leagues and player unions from around the world to ask football's lawmakers to trial temporary concussion substitutes.

item.title: Chelsea in talks for Rennes defender Jacquet
item.description: Chelsea hold talks to sign Rennes centre-back Jeremy Jacquet during the winter transfer window.

item.title: Ajax hoping to secure loan move for Zinchenko
item.description: Ajax are in talks over a loan move for Arsenal defender Oleksandr Zinchenko.

item.title: New signings help Liverpool spark to life but real test awaits
item.description: Women's FA Cup fourth‑round victory over fourth-tier London Bees finally offer Liverpool a moment of light in a campaign that has felt extremely bleak.

item.title: Ambitious Spurs eye Champions League spot after WSL rise
item.description: A year ago, Tottenham lived in the shadows of a Women's Super League relegation fight. Today, they sit level on points with third-placed Arsenal after collecting 23 from 12 matches.

item.title: Man Utd players 'really care' - Carrick on derby heroics
item.description: Manchester United boss Michael Carrick praises the attitude his players have shown since taking over, following his side's 2-0 derby victory against Manchester City in the Premier League.

item.title: How Carrick's Man Utd dismantled Man City
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Alan Shearer and Wayne Rooney break down how Manchester United's shape frustrated Manchester City in Michael Carrick's first game as interim manager.

item.title: Crystal Palace 'abandoned' by board - Glasner
item.description: Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner is left frustrated after his side's defeat by Sunderland, saying the club's board have "abandoned'" them and he can no longer stay quiet because he wants to "defend his players".

item.title: 'I'll be surprised if he's here next game' - Shearer on Glasner
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Alan Shearer expects Oliver Glasner to leave Crystal Palace in the coming week, after his outburst against the board in the wake of their defeat by Sunderland.

item.title: Newcastle lacked 'cutting edge' in draw against Wolves - Howe
item.description: Newcastle United manager Eddie Howe says his side controlled the game but were unable to find a "moment of magic" to score in their goalless draw against Wolves in the Premier League.

item.title: Missed opportunity for Arsenal - but were they denied 'clear penalty'?
item.description: Arsenal have moved seven points clear at the top of the Premier League after a 0-0 draw at Nottingham Forest - but should the Gunners have been awarded a penalty?

item.title: 'No energy' and 'predictable' - Guardiola won't blame VAR for derby loss
item.description: Manchester City were outfought by rivals Manchester United on Saturday lunchtime and the damaging defeat could leave them outmanoeuvred in this season's Premier League title race.

item.title: Glasner 'feels abandoned completely' at Palace
item.description: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner says he feels his squad "are being abandoned completely" by the club's hierarchy.

item.title: A 'perfect' start for Carrick - how Man Utd ran Man City ragged
item.description: Michael Carrick gets his interim spell as Mancheter United head coach off to the perfect start as they out-play their Manchester rivals at Old Trafford.

item.title: How Malaga-born Diaz became Morocco's national icon
item.description: "100% Spanish" and "100% Moroccan" - Africa Cup of Nations final awaits Brahim Diaz, who has become an icon and the symbol of a modern and ambitious Morocco.

item.title: 'I share the same frustrations as the fans' - Slot on Anfield boos
item.description: Arne Slot responds after Liverpool are booed by sections of their home support in the 1-1 draw with Burnley at Anfield on Saturday.

item.title: Handball was a 'clear penalty' to Arsenal - Arteta
item.description: Mikel Arteta was unhappy with the decision to not award Arsenal a penalty, after Ola Aina handled the ball inside Nottingham Forest's penalty area in their draw at The City Ground.

item.title: 'Incredibly harsh' if Arsenal penalty was given - Dyche
item.description: Nottingham Forest manager Sean Dyche says he's happy with his team's "commitment" during their goalless draw against Arsenal and believes it would have been "incredibly harsh" had the Gunners been awarded a penalty for a possible handball by Ola Aina.

item.title: Mbappe scores as Arbeloa earns first win as Real boss
item.description: Kylian Mbappe scores a penalty in a comfortable win for Real Madrid over Levante, giving Alvaro Arbeloa his first win as Real Madrid boss. The victory came amid protests from fans at the Bernabeu.

item.title: Frank understands booing Spurs fans' frustration
item.description: Thomas Frank says he has the backing of the club's hierarchy, but admits he sympathises with the fans who booed his side after a 2-1 loss at home to West Ham United.

item.title: 'The fans have spoken' - Why Frank's future at Spurs looks bleak
item.description: Match of the Day's Mark Chapman, Alan Shearer and Wayne Rooney explain why they think Thomas Frank's time as Tottenham Hotspur manager is about to come to an end following his side's 2-1 home defeat to West Ham.

item.title: Was this the day Spurs fans finally lost all faith in Frank?
item.description: Was the dismal home loss to struggling West Ham the day Spurs fans finally lost all faith in head coach Thomas Frank, asks chief football writer Phil McNulty?

item.title: Huddersfield sack manager Grant after eight months
item.description: Huddersfield Town sack manager Lee Grant after eight months in charge following a run of four games without a win.

item.title: Coventry back on track but Baggies in trouble - Aaron McLean's EFL takeaways
item.description: Final Score pundit Aaron McLean gives his five takeaways from what we learned across the Championship, League One and League Two this weekend.

item.title: Wrexham could trim 'very strong squad' before window closes
item.description: BBC Sport Wales looks at how the final fortnight of the January transfer window could unfold for Championship side Wrexham.

item.title: Liverpool sign O'Sullivan for club record fee
item.description: Republic of Ireland midfielder Denise O'Sullivan says it is "a proud moment" to join Liverpool following her move from North Carolina Courage.

item.title: Guehi set for Sunday medical before £20m Man City move
item.description: Crystal Palace defender Marc Guehi is set to have a medical at Manchester City on Sunday before completing a £20m move.

item.title: Boots from Easter Bunny and teenage parties - Glasner tells his story
item.description: Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner sits down with Kelly Somers to talk about his background and career in football.

item.title: 'Results, results' - how Guardiola outlasted five Man Utd bosses
item.description: Pep Guardiola takes on a sixth different Manchester United boss in Saturday's derby as he approaches a decade at City, but how has he outlasted all of those before Michael Carrick?

item.title: From Fiji to Latvia - are cross-border leagues the future?
item.description: The OFC Professional League kicks off this week and a Baltic League has been proposed, so is there a future for cross-border football competitions?

item.title: Rejections, depression & promise to his mum - Thiago's route to top
item.description: Igor Thiago's route to the Premier League has been far from straightforward - BBC Sport charts the rise of Brentford's record-breaking Brazilian striker.

item.title: Is Wenger's daylight idea the solution to fix offside?
item.description: Is the offside law about to change to Arsene Wenger's daylight idea? And should football make that change just because of VAR?

item.title: Transfers - January 2026
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: How much has Guardiola spent on defenders at Man City?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at how many defenders Manchester City have signed since Pep Guardiola arrived at the Etihad.

item.title: What is it like to be a caretaker manager?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what life is like as a caretaker boss after Michael Carrick's appointment at Manchester United, with Neil Warnock and Phil Brown detailing their experiences.

item.title: Who is Manchester City debutant Max Alleyne?
item.description: Manchester City defender Max Alleyne will make his Premier League debut on Wednesday after being named in Pep Guardiola's team to face Brighton.

item.title: Why is there no VAR in the FA Cup third and fourth round?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain why VAR is not in use in the third and fourth rounds of the FA Cup.

item.title: What is the Women's Champions Cup and who will Arsenal play?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Fifa's new Women's Champions Cup.

item.title: Is the new manager bounce real or a myth?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains whether the new manager bounce is real, or just a myth

item.title: Is a leg break worse than an ACL tear?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the different recovery periods for common football injuries.

item.title: Dundee reject Portsmouth bid for Graham - gossip
item.description: Dundee turn down an offer from Portsmouth for Luke Graham as Motherwell are linked with Barry Bannan and striker target Eythor Bjorgolfsson is spotted at Fir Park.

item.title: 'He's a good healer' - McInnes hopes for positive Shankland news
item.description: Derek McInnes hopes Lawrence Shankland's injury "settles" this week as he hinted he may add to Hearts midfield options.

item.title: 'If Flick hadn't come, I would have left Barca' - Raphinha
item.description: Raphinha has become one of Barcelona's most dependable performers and a decisive figure in their biggest matches, which he credits Hansi Flick for.

item.title: Tottenham sign Gallagher from Atletico for £35m
item.description: The former Chelsea midfielder joins Spurs on a deal until 2031.

item.title: Why Alonso's reign is over at Real Madrid
item.description: After Xabi Alonso's departure as Real Madrid manager, Spanish football expert Guillem Balague looks into where it all went wrong.

item.title: Spurs sporting director Paratici to join Fiorentina
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur sporting director Fabio Paratici will leave Spurs at the end of the January transfer window to join Serie A side Fiorentina.

item.title: Brighton boss Vidosic on leave for family reasons
item.description: Brighton manager Dario Vidosic will take a period of leave for private family reasons, the club have confirmed.

item.title: Leicester close in on Lehmann signing from FC Como
item.description: Leicester City are closing in on the signing of Switzerland forward Alisha Lehmann from FC Como this month.

item.title: Kerr scores two as Chelsea thrash Palace in FA Cup
item.description: Sam Kerr scores two as holders Chelsea beat Crystal Palace 5-0 in the Women's FA Cup, while Sunderland lose to London City.

item.title: Twelve-year ban for 'misogynistic' women's coach
item.description: A former women's football coach is banned from the sport for 12 years after bombarding players and a member of staff with explicit images and suggesting they have sex.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
